Alan \"Dutch\" Schaefer.Action: Arrives at the command post calmly despite fatigue, lights a cigar, and moves with casual confidence toward the mission area.
His fatigue is noticeable, which might imply physical strain or mental exhaustion upon arrival.
Responds warmly to General Philips with informal salute and friendly exchange.
Maintains serious and professional demeanor when discussing the situation.
Responds with a grin and familiar banter when seeing Dillon, indicating camaraderie and warmth toward a colleague.
States they don't work with outsiders when told another person will join, showing distrust or guardedness toward new people.
Engages in friendly arm-wrestling contest with Dillon, shares laughter and mutual respect.
Refuses a job he deems assassin-style, emphasizing his team's rescuing nature, expresses subtle humor.
Confidently asserts that the mission is manageable and 'nothing we can't handle alone.'
Shows hesitation or reluctance about losing command to Dillon but still prepares his men.
Grins at Ramirez with a boyish, eager face, showing friendly engagement.
Handles stressful, physically demanding situations with ease, such as maintaining composure during radical helicopter maneuvers.
Communicates efficiently with Dillon, maintains focus on mission details calmly.
Acknowledges the harsh reality of their mission with dry humor ('This gets better by the minute').
Communicates effectively with Dillon using headsets; consults a topographical map to confirm rendezvous points and radio frequencies.
Asks about backup and responds appropriately when told there is none, demonstrating awareness of mission risk and no false optimism.
Reads and approves the clipboard handed by the Co-Pilot, showing attention to detail and command responsibility.
Responds to Dillon's enthusiastic comment with a teasing insult ('You never were all that smart...let's go!!!') before signaling the team to rappel.
Leads the team with clear, effective gestures and maintains cohesion and communication in difficult terrain.
Follows pointman quietly and attentively, showing respect for team roles and collaboration.
Focuses on mission and navigation without overt interpersonal engagement or emotional expression.
Makes clear hand signals to coordinate team movement in perfect harmony and point-lock step, indicating leadership and control.
Checks his compass and signals a new direction to the team, showing navigation skills and situational awareness.
Follows Ramirez closely and remains highly focused and alert to every sound and movement, showing tactical awareness and attentiveness.
Taps Ramirez on the shoulder and directs him away quietly before talking to Dillon.
Focuses on tactical situation and monitors his team's findings carefully without showing impatience or frustration.

Kneels beside a bloody pile of clothing and entrails, examines dog tags, recognizes a fallen comrade, shows hardened and bitter expression, but directs Mac to cut down the bodies without showing overt emotion.
Asks Dillon sharply about the strange presence of Green Berets in the area, showing anger but concern about the situation, indicating a sense of responsibility toward fallen soldiers.
Walks off after angering at the situation, avoiding further conversation or emotional display in this moment.
Examines the scene carefully, identifies a fallen comrade from the dog tag, and questions the situation intelligently and critically.
Shows strong emotional reaction but maintains focus on the mission by ordering Mac to cut down the bodies and pressing Dillon for answers.
Walks off abruptly after exchanging tense words without a clear plan or follow-up, possibly showing frustration interfering with tactical thinking.
Asks Billy questions with concern about the missing men and the firefight, showing attentiveness and thoughtfulness.
Gives direct tactical orders to the team to move silently and spread out, focusing on mission efficiency without evident warmth or friendliness.
Turns and leaves the clearing cautiously, moving into the jungle with awareness of surroundings.
Works closely and communicates effectively with teammate Ramirez, acknowledging silently.
Carefully observes enemy camp along with Ramirez, sharing information non-verbally.
Advances cautiously with the team, scouts the guerrilla village from a concealed position using binoculars, identifies enemy assets including a guard with a rocket launcher and a radio set.
Watches a prisoner being tortured and executed, showing cold determination and quickly moving on without expressing visible empathy or compassion.
Displays cold determination after witnessing a murder, quickly regroups his team and gives a clear, decisive order to take the prisoners immediately without delay.
Uses subtle and effective nonverbal communication (circling thumb) to silently gather his team for a huddle, showing command presence and coordination skill.
Signals to kill a sentry silently with a combat knife, showing tactical ruthlessness.
Silently signals and skillfully kills a sentry with a combat knife, showing tactical precision and stealth.
Carefully studies the environment and assesses mechanical setups near the enemy camp, demonstrating situational awareness and strategic thinking.
Moves tactically and silently, prepares to neutralize threats without unnecessary escalation
Directs and coordinates ambush with team members showing trust and reliance
Engages in violent action (part of team violence against enemy guard)
Uses great physical effort to silently move a truck to create a surprise attack, showing resourcefulness and commitment to his team's mission.
Leads the attack by aggressively firing to protect and advance with his team.
Races down the hillside under fire with a teammate, demonstrating teamwork and trust.
Rolls to his feet, spins, firing the 203 grenade launcher, completely destroying the hut.
Tackles Dillon to protect him from an imminent gunfire.
Freezes momentarily when seeing danger, then actively engages enemies to protect the group.
Tells Ramirez to 'Stick around' and covers him while he checks a room, showing protective teamwork.
Shouts a warning to Ramirez ('Down!!!') to protect him from an incoming attack, then physically intervenes to save him.
Shouts clear, concise commands to team members to coordinate positions and situation updates urgently.
Focuses on tactical objectives and quickly assesses hostile environments without visible emotional reaction to dead hostages.
Checks pulse of unconscious woman, shows concern despite her condition.
Gives clear, direct orders to team to clear area and prepare to move.
Passively staring out the window with weapon slack, holding papers, allowing Dillon to take the lead with excitement.
Sitting calmly, holding weapon slack, observing through window while others are active and excited about important information.
Confronts Dillon angrily and accuses him of betrayal and setting them up for dirty work.
Confronts Dillon about risking men's lives and asserts that his men are not expendable.
Crumples up Dillon's paper and rejects the dirty war he represents.
Turns away from Dillon in apparent disapproval and moves to attend to the wounded Anna.
Touches Hawkins on the shoulder and instructs to move in five minutes, showing concern and urgency for team coordination.
Opposes taking Anna with the group fearing she will give away their position, showing distrust and a no-prisoners attitude.
Accepts Dillon's decision to bring Anna despite personal objection, showing some tolerance and respect for chain of command.
Warns Dillon that if the team falls behind, they are on their own, emphasizing mission priority over personal empathy.
Carefully studies the map with Billy, considers terrain and safety, discusses options calmly and decisively with team.
Takes leadership role, gives clear orders, demonstrates responsibility for team safety.
Observes Anna with bandaged forehead and bound hands silently, does not intervene in her apparent mistreatment.
No direct action or involvement in this excerpt; other characters respond to threats and dangers.
Leads his team cautiously through dense jungle terrain, maintaining awareness and moving quietly despite difficult conditions.
Glances around, checking the team's position and progress while moving cautiously.
Holds up his hand to signal the team to freeze, showing leadership and concern for their safety.
Moves cautiously and attentively, monitoring the team's position and progress while navigating difficult terrain.
Holds up his hand to signal the team to freeze, demonstrating situational awareness and leadership in a tense moment.
Senses something wrong with Billy and moves cautiously alongside Mac to investigate, signaling for cover and moving low and quiet towards Billy.
Approaches Billy, gripping his shoulders and whispering his name to get his attention.
Forcefully jerks Billy around to face him when he does not respond.
Attempts to engage and assess Billy's unusual behavior and concerns about the jungle despite no immediate visible threat.
Dismisses Billy's fear by concluding there is 'nothing' in the trees without clear evidence.
Approaches Anna, who is terrified and bloodied, with anger and wariness but does not lash out, instead quickly moves on letting the team protect her.
Whistles low and sharp upon hearing gunfire, signaling awareness and control of the situation.
Runs forward twenty paces immediately after Ramirez to provide coordinated cover and maintain team security.
Observes the terrified Anna, notes the blood and crushed grass trail, and follows it methodically, demonstrating tactical acumen and composure under pressure.
Seems angry and wary upon seeing Anna, but does not let emotions interfere with mission focus, instead continues pursuit.
Checks Anna for wounds and wipes blood from her face, showing concern.
Expresses shock and confusion over Hawkins' missing body, indicating emotional engagement with the team's wellbeing.
Directs Ramirez to gently question Anna about what happened, demonstrating leadership combined with care.
Checks Anna for wounds and quickly concludes the blood is not hers, showing attention to detail.
Expresses shock and confusion at finding Hawkins' entrails without his body, showing human reaction but does not panic.
Delegates Ramirez to question Anna about the situation, utilizing team resources appropriately.
Quietly questions why Hawkins' radio and weapon were not taken and why the girl didn't escape, showing thoughtful concern.
Immediately orders a systematic search to find Hawkins, showing responsibility and care for his team member.
Does not appear or act in this excerpt; no indication of competence can be assessed from these scenes featuring other characters.
Moves in front of Mac to presumably shield or steady him during intense combat tension.
Stares intently into the jungle, prepared but composed, showing focus rather than panic.
Moves in front of Mac to steady or protect him during a tense moment while the team is alert and ready.
Turns quickly to Blain's body and kneels alongside Dillon, showing shock and concern.
Shakes Mac violently by the shoulders to bring him back to awareness, demanding answers in an angry tone.
Orders the team to bury Blain respectfully in the morning.
Focuses primarily on tactical defensive positioning and command.
Orders the team to take a defensive, fortified position with mines before nightfall, showing tactical foresight and leadership under pressure.
Commands the respectful handling of a fallen comrade's body, demonstrating discipline and concern for team morale.
Places his hand on Mac's shoulder and expresses condolences, acknowledging the difficulty of losing a good soldier.
Calls out the military command for abandoning them, showing frustration but acknowledging their dire situation with Dillon.
Rushes at a crouching run toward the foxhole to assist Mac during a life-threatening attack.
Approaches the scene cautiously but supports his team member after a violent encounter.
Helps the still shaken Mac from the hole and instructs to get a field dressing on his chest wound immediately.
Shows concern for Anna, asking where she is and noting her frightened appearance as she seeks security with the soldiers.
Immediately orders a field dressing for the wounded Mac, demonstrating quick medical judgment and leadership under pressure.
Remembers to check on Anna’s whereabouts amid the chaos, showing situational awareness and concern for team safety.
Kneels and carefully examines the trip wire and surrounding ground to understand how the body was taken, showing attentiveness and concern for his team’s situation.
Looks at Ramirez after his question about why the enemy didn't attack last night, without immediately dismissing or mocking, indicating he is listening and considering teammates’ thoughts.
Looks at Billy asking with his eyes for an explanation; pulls Anna firmly to her feet and looks at her intensely; insists on getting honest answers
Takes Anna's hands gently and looks into her eyes before slicing through her bonds.
Firmly insists everyone stays and makes a stand to protect each other despite danger and pressure to escape.
Strains with every ounce of strength to haul down a heavy vine, setting an elaborate trap despite others' doubts
Hauls down on a heavy vine, straining with every ounce of strength, demonstrating physical capability and persistence.
Successfully draws a forty-foot sapling into a makeshift bow, showing ingenuity and tactical skill.
Gestures to Dillon to tie off the sapling, effectively delegating and coordinating team actions.
Ignores Dillon's protest about the 'boy scout stunt,' suggesting confidence and focus on the plan despite dissent.
Carefully covers a net with leaves and debris to camouflage it, showing attention to detail and tactical foresight.
Persists in setting up a complex trap despite Dillon's frustration and dismissal.
Shares a subtle acknowledgment of the danger with Dillon, indicating some trust and openness.
Focuses on tactical preparations and waits silently with the team, showing professional detachment and little friendly interaction.
Carefully approaches and inspects the jungle trap while others cover him; shows measured caution and responsibility toward his team.
Glares at Dillon's teasing remark but does not escalate conflict.
Walks back to camp after failed attempt, acknowledging failure without blaming others.
Spins quickly and leads charge toward the net, weapons ready.
Dives for safety along with others when limb crashes down.
Momentarily frozen in shock, looking upward after Ramirez is injured.
Orders Billy to get Ramirez on his feet and evacuate the girl, showing concern for his team’s safety.
Shares a moment of silent understanding and trust with Dillon, throwing him a spare weapon acknowledging the danger and their bond.
Disagrees with Dillon’s choice to pursue the Hunter alone, showing concern and an attempt to protect others.
Supports injured Ramirez, lifts him to his feet, helps him out of danger.
Gives clear instructions to Billy about radio use and leaving others behind for evacuation.
Does not appear in this excerpt and takes no direct action or display of competence.
Stops and listens carefully to Dillon's gunfire, preparing to respond cautiously with Ramirez and Anna.
Protects Anna by sweeping her behind him and kicking the weapon out of her reach to prevent harm.
Commands Anna to run to safety while he covers their retreat.
Fires at the Hunter while ensuring Anna escapes, even though shots are not effective.
Hikes Ramirez onto his back and sprints to the top of the hill despite the dangerous situation, showing physical capability and decisiveness.
Immediately raises and cocks his weapon and orders the group to get behind cover upon hearing Billy's scream, demonstrating readiness and quick situational awareness.
Sweeps Anna behind him to protect her and covers the ridgeline, showing tactical protection of teammates and defensive positioning.
Kicks the MP-5 rifle out of Anna’s reach to prevent her from risking herself and orders her to run to the chopper, indicating clear-headed leadership under stress.
Fires at the Hunter while it attacks, but bullets hit the ground and do not stop the enemy, showing limited effective marksmanship under pressure.
Fires at the Hunter to protect Anna and allows her to escape.
Focuses entirely on survival and fighting the Hunter, with no indication of reaching out or showing concern beyond immediate self-preservation.
Collapses exhausted but shows persistence by struggling to escape and survive.
Frozen in terror, paralyzed and awaiting death without resistance.
Manages to swim to shore despite being exhausted and nearly drowned.
Crawls into a mud overhang and covers himself with mud to hide from the Hunter.
Focuses and scans for signs of the Hunter after reaching shore, showing situational awareness.
Freezes in terror, paralyzed and unable to act when the Hunter approaches closely.
Closes his eyes and passively awaits death instead of trying to escape or fight back at close range.
Uses mud to mask his body heat, aiding in survival without harming others.
Remains focused on survival despite pain and exhaustion, no aggressive or hostile behavior toward others noted here.
Looks at his muddied reflection, shows self-awareness and determination after realizing camouflage gives him an advantage.
Carefully creates and tends a fire using available resources, demonstrating resourcefulness but no interpersonal warmth.
Carefully crafts weapons and explosives with attention to detail, preparing for a critical moment.
Constructs a functional bow and arrow from natural materials, using piano wire and reinforcing with tape, showing knowledge of weapon crafting and attention to detail.
Coats arrow tips with poison derived from natural substances, demonstrating skilled use of available resources and effective preparation for hunting or combat.

Improvises an explosive device using the propellant powder from a 40mm grenade, magnesium shavings, and first aid gauze, showing creativity, technical knowledge, and confidence in making improvised weaponry.
Prepares weapons and camouflage with great care and focus, working alone in the wilderness.
Builds a fire carefully and silently then releases a deep, primal shout from his soul, expressing raw emotion.
Sits motionless, nearly invisible in mud camouflage amid darkness, remaining calm and focused despite a wounded shoulder, draws bow steadily aiming at the Hunter.
Freezes at the sound of the Hunter dropping nearby, eyes wide with fear, aware that any movement could provoke instant attack but is also vulnerable by waiting.
Responds immediately and attentively to Anna's warning voice, indicating trust and concern for others' safety.
Moves cautiously and quietly alone towards dangerous sounds, showing focus on the mission rather than seeking company or reassurance.
Draws back on the bow and moves carefully toward the sound of the Hunter, attempting to stalk and track his prey.
Pauses and listens carefully when confused by echoing sounds of the Hunter's footsteps, showing cautious awareness.
Freezes and crouches upon hearing a soft, unexpected human voice, demonstrating appropriate caution and alertness rather than reckless behavior.
Becomes uncertain where to turn due to confusing echoes, indicating momentary hesitation.
Carefully prepares and throws a flash-grenade to defend himself from the Hunter's attack.
Savagely kicks the Hunter's arm and chest, aggressively attacks.
Draws bow and stands poised over wounded opponent, showing no mercy.
Expresses incredulity and verbally questions the Hunter's identity rather than being hostile.
Climbs onto the boulder despite searing shoulder pain, showing determination and physical capability.
Follows the blood trail cautiously and carefully, showing tactical awareness and patience.
Successfully disarms the Hunter with a kick and immediately follows up with a karate kick to incapacitate him, demonstrating combat skill and quick reflexes.
Draws his bow and positions himself over the Hunter strategically after subduing him, indicating tactical dominance.
Expresses incredulity upon seeing the Hunter's face, momentarily distracted or caught off guard by the unexpected nature of the opponent.
Focuses on survival and kills the Hunter in a desperate, instinctual act to save himself.
Pursues the wounded Hunter carefully and cautiously, showing respect for the danger and the other being's suffering.
Stops and reassesses upon sensing something wrong with the spider web trap, avoiding a potential harm rather than rushing recklessly.
Observes the gruesome scene of skinned bodies and human skins stretched over frames with astonishment and rage.
Does not hesitate to pursue the Hunter despite his weakened condition.
Shows no visible reaction of disgust or panic; keeps focus on tracking and following the Hunter.
Focuses on activating and using the Hunter's weapon in a desperate, rage-fueled effort to fight, showing primarily self-preservation and determination rather than concern for others.
Runs desperately to find cover, ignoring his own serious injuries, indicating a strong drive to survive but does not show explicit care or concern for others in this excerpt.
Finds and picks up the Hunter's weapon and activates it under extreme physical weakness and stress.
Successfully uses the unfamiliar weapon to destroy the Hunter right before escape.
Despite pain and exhaustion, quickly assesses danger of the ship explosion and seeks cover.
Realizes his ship is about to explode and immediately sprints for cover despite serious injuries.
Dives over the embankment just in time to avoid being destroyed by the blast.
Approaches a heavily armed helicopter alone and dazed, indicating vulnerability and trust in recognition by Anna.
Does not respond threateningly to guns pointed at him despite injuries and tension.
Approaches a heavily armed helicopter calmly despite being outnumbered and in a vulnerable state, showing composure and control.
Appears dazed and stunned when confronted by armed men, suggesting momentary disorientation.
Touches Anna's fingers and clasps her hand after recognition, sharing a moment of connection and gratitude.
Returns Anna's look with recognition and a faint smile, indicating a sincere and positive bond.
Survives severe physical trauma and dangerous conditions, maintaining composure and indicating resilience.
Shares a meaningful, recognizing moment of connection with Anna, showing emotional awareness and presence.
His survival and condition leave others in awe, implying effective skills and leadership in hostile environment.
